moves.1. e4: Hi everyone, had a good week this week - managed two draws against 1950  oppo.  Here is the first of the two.  Both games were Sicilians so good results.  Joanne
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5: 3. Bb5 - this move is the start of the Nimzo-Rossolimo attack which had a similar start to my game Pawn Stab.  My 1900  opponent plays the opening differently, however.
moves.3... g6 4. Bxc6 bxc6 5. O-O Bg7 6. Re1 N: 6. ........ Nh6 - this knight will go to f7 on move 11.
moves.7. c3 O-O 8. d4 cxd4 9. cxd4: 9. c xd4 - white has a pawn centre but can this be maintained?
moves.9... d6 10. Nc3 f6 11. b3 Nf7 12. Bb2: 12. Bb2 - development nearly completed and it is when I play Qc2 next move.
moves.12... Ba6 13. Qc2 Qd7 14. Rad1: 14. Rad1 - after black played Ba6 on his 12th move I completed my development with my 13th and decided to centralise my queen rook to support my pawn centre.
moves.14... e5 15. dxe5 fxe5 16. Ba3: 16. Ba3 - after my pawn centre was busted a move ago I decide to pin and try and pile up on the d pawn.
moves.16... Qe6 17. Bc1: 17. Bc1 - bishop retreats to home square - I now try to force a knight exchange on g5 but black stops it with h6 - weakening his castled position.  I note this but at the moment cannot find anything to attack it with.
moves.17... h6 18. Bb2 Rac8 19. Qb1: 19. Qb1 - Glenda moves out of the way of the black rook on the c file and I prepare to put a rook on the c file to negate the black rook's control at a later date.
moves.19... g5 20. Nd2: 20.  Nd2 - this knight is making a tour to g3 hoping to come in on f5 or h5 to try and force an exchange of knight for dsb.
24. ........ Qf7 - the Wicked Witch of the West foils my plan, however.  Black now has a good pawn centre and a passed d pawn and a strong lsb.  Offset against it is a black isolani on a7 - also, Glenda has a clear line from b1-h7 - I would lurve Frere Leblanc to be on the board here but unfortunately he ain't so I must think of another way.
moves.25. f3: 25. f3 - this move allows Henry to move to h1 if necessary.
moves.25... Bb7: 25. .......... Bb7 - this move allows me to contest the c file without worrying about my d2 knight being lost should my g3 knight be driven away.
moves.26. Rdc1 Rde8:
26. ........ Re8 and DRAW OFFER!, or more pertinently for me, 6 rating points are on offer - I decide to run with the money!  In a post match analysis Coach Ion had the following to say:-

"I don't know what you had planned for next move, but Ba3 looks OK with the view of coming in at c5, after which a2-a4 and/or b3-b4 suggest themselves."

So, this is all worth noting if I find myself in a similar position later on.  For now I am a very happy lady and now, get ready for Near-Expert Draw Part II.
